intro: Vincentella ogouensis, commonly known as the West African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in open woodland areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners in warm climates.
